chav1961.purelib.streams.char2char

Class PreprocessingReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • chav1961.purelib.streams.char2char.PreprocessingReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Readable

    public class PreprocessingReader
extends Reader

    This class implements preprocessing for the reader nested. It supports a set of preprocessor operators:

    • #define and #undef - define and undefine global-known preprocessor variable(s)
    • #if, #elseif, #else and #endif - conditional preprocessing (can be nested)
    • #include - include additional character stream from the given URI (can be nested)
    • #error and #warning - fire error or warning with the given message
    • substitutions of the preprocessor variables (can be recursive)

    Lines to remove from input stream by preprocessing can be excluded from the input stream on can be commented in the input stream (by inline or multiline user-defined comment sequences)

    Syntax of the preprocessor operators is:

    #define <variable_name> <any_value_including_blank_chars>

    #undef <variable_name>

    #if <expression>

    . . .

    #elseif <expression>

    . . .

    #else

    . . .

    #endif

    #include {"<resource_uri>"|<resource_uri>}

    #warning <any text>

    #error <any text>

    Syntax of the preprocessor expression is:

    <expression>::=<or_expression>[ || <or_expression>]

    <or_expression>::=<and_expression>[ && <and_expression>]

    <and_expression>::=[ ! ]<comparison>

    <comparison>::={[?]<variable>|<variable>{==|!=|>=|<=|>|<}<value>|(<expression>)}

    <value>::="any_text_except_nl"

    To make control for the preprocessor, you can use a set of key-value pairs:

    • BUFFER_SIZE - size of the input buffer (default is 8192)
    • HIDING_METHOD - method of hiding lines, excluding on the preprocessor stage (see hidingMethod enumeration)
    • INLINE_SUBSTITUTION - true means substitute of the preprocessor variable's values in the input stream
    • RECURSIVE_SUBSTITUTION - true means processing of the values substituted earlier
    • IGNORE_CASE - true ignores case of preprocessor commands and variables
    • ERROR_PROCESSING_CALLBACK - an interface to process errors & warnings detected. Default throws an IOException on errors and ignores warnings
    • COMMENT_SEQUENCE - a list of comment sequences, splitted by \n and \t chars.

    Example of the comment sequence for Java language is:

    //\n/*\t*/

    The \n character splits one comment sequence from another. The \t character 'represents' content of the multi-line comments. Missing \t character inside the comment sequence is treated as inline comment sequence. Inline comment can be used as comment sequence inside the preprocessor operators.

    You can use user-defined lambda-styled callback PreprocessingReader.IncludeCallback to process #include statements (for example, to get it's content from database). Default uses a standard URL functionality to get content from.

    The class in not thread-safe

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    Reader, JUnit tests

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PreprocessingReader.ErrorProcessingCallback
      This interface describes callback to process #error and #warning message for PreprocessingReader class
      static class  PreprocessingReader.HidingMethod
      This enumeration describes method to process content need be excluded from the input stream for PreprocessingReader class: PreprocessingReader.HidingMethod.EXCLUDE - exclude this content from the input stream PreprocessingReader.HidingMethod.SINGLE_LINE_COMMENTED - retain this content in the input stream with inline comment prefixed for each line to exclude PreprocessingReader.HidingMethod.MULTILINE_COMMENTED - retain this content in the input stream with multi-line comment around all block to exclude
      static interface  PreprocessingReader.IncludeCallback
      This functional interface describes callback to process include statements for PreprocessingReader class

      • IGNORE_CASE

        public static final String IGNORE_CASE

        Map key for value 'Ignore case of preprocessor commands'. It's value can be true or false only

        See Also:

      • BUFFER_SIZE

        public static final String BUFFER_SIZE

        Map key for value 'Character buffer size to read content from'. It's value is positive integer. Default is 8192.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HIDING_METHOD

        public static final String HIDING_METHOD

        Map key for value 'Hiding method to exclude source content on conditional preprocessing'. Can be instance of PreprocessingReader.HidingMethod only

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INLINE_SUBSTITUTION

        public static final String INLINE_SUBSTITUTION

        Map key for value 'Support inline substitution'. It's value can be true or false only. If false or missing, no preprocessor variables will be substituted in the input stream content.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RECURSIVE_SUBSTITUTION

        public static final String RECURSIVE_SUBSTITUTION

        Map key for value 'Allow parsing of substituted content'. It's value can be true or false only. Default is false

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_PROCESSING_CALLBACK

        public static final String ERROR_PROCESSING_CALLBACK

        Map key for value 'Callback to process #error and #warning preprocessor operators'. Can be implementation of PreprocessingReader.ErrorProcessingCallback only

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMENT_SEQUENCE

        public static final String COMMENT_SEQUENCE

        Map key for value 'Character sequence to use as inline and/or multi-line comments'. If presents, can be non-empty string only

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • PreprocessingReader

        public PreprocessingReader(Reader nestedReader)

        Create reader with the nested source and default settings.

        Parameters:
        nestedReader - reader to use as content source. Can't be null

      • PreprocessingReader

        public PreprocessingReader(Reader nestedReader,
                           Map<String,Object> varsAndOptions)

        Create reader with the nested source and explicitly typed settings.

        Parameters:
        nestedReader - reader to use as content source. Can't be null
        varsAndOptions - explicitly typed options. Can't be null. Use static string keys defined in the class as key names for the map. Changing it's content during processing data is not affected on processing behavior, but will take effect on all #include content

      • PreprocessingReader

        public PreprocessingReader(Reader nestedReader,
                           Map<String,Object> varsAndOptions,
                           PreprocessingReader.IncludeCallback includeCallback)

        Create reader with the nested source, explicitly typed settings and special case to process #include statements

        Parameters:
        nestedReader - reader to use as content source. Can't be null
        varsAndOptions - explicitly typed options. Can't be null. Use static string keys defined in the class as key names for the map. Changing it's content during processing data is not affected on processing behavior, but will take effect on all #include content
        includeCallback - include callback to get reader for the given include URI. Can't be null
